subtitle: A really nice starter. Garnish with a few salad leaves.

method.text: Using a 11 cm round fluted cutter, cut each slice of bread into a round. Place in a shallow dish with 50g of the melted butter until well coated.
Use to line individual tartlet moulds (or use a large Yorkshire pudding tin). Weigh the bread down with greaseproof paper and baking beans. Place in the oven for 10 min.
Meanwhile place the remaining butter in a frying pan. Add the shallots and bacon and fry together for 3-5 min or until browned. Add the mushrooms to the pan and fry for a further 2 min.
Remove the paper and baking beans from the bread cases. Bake for a further 10 min or until bottom becomes brown and crispy.
Stir the tomato ketchup and Worcestershire sauce into the shallot and bacon mixture. Season to taste and simmer together for a further 5 min.
Remove the bread cases from the tin, spoon in the filling, sprinkle over the parsley and top each with a little soured cream. Serve while still warm.

title: Parsleyed bacon and shallot cups
